questiontext.text:
Exercise

In some questions below it will be necessary to apply integration by parts more than once.

Find

  1. \({\displaystyle\int x\cos kx\mathrm{d}x}\), where \(k\) is a constant [[input:ans9]] [[validation:ans9]] [[feedback:prt9]]
  2. \({\displaystyle\int z^2\cos kz\mathrm{d}z}\), where \(k\) is a constant [[input:ans10]] [[validation:ans10]] [[feedback:prt10]]

Oppgave

Regn ut

  1. \({\displaystyle\int x\cos kx\mathrm{d}x}\), hvor \(k\) er en konstant [[input:ans9]] [[validation:ans9]] [[feedback:prt9]]
  2. \({\displaystyle\int z^2\cos kz\mathrm{d}z}\), hvor \(k\) er en konstant [[input:ans10]] [[validation:ans10]] [[feedback:prt10]]

generalfeedback.text:
We apply integraton by parts: \[ \int u{{\rm d}v\over {\rm d}x}{\rm d}x=uv- \int{{\rm d}u\over {\rm d}x}v\,{\rm d}x\]

or alternatively: \[\int f(x)g(x)\,{\rm d}x=f(x)\,\int g(x){\rm d}x -\int {{\rm d}f\over {\rm d}x}\left\{\int g(x){\rm d}x\right\}{\rm d}x.\]

  1. We are given the integral \({\displaystyle\int {@exp9@} \mathrm{d}x}.\)

    We have \( f(x) = {@f9@}\) and \(g(x) = {@g9@}.\)

    Hence:

    \(\begin{align} \int {@exp9@} \mathrm{d}x &={@f9@} \int {@g9@} \mathrm{d}x -\int \left({@df9@} \cdot \int {@g9@}\mathrm{d}x \right)\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@f9* intg9@}- \int {@df9*intg9@}\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@ta9@}. \end{align}\)

  2. We are given the integral \(\displaystyle{ \int {@exp10@} \mathrm{d}z}.\)

    We have \( f(z) = {@f10@}\) and \(g(z) = {@g10@}.\)

    Hence:

    \(\begin{align} \int {@exp10@} \mathrm{d}z &={@f10@} \int {@g10@} \mathrm{d}z -\int \left({@df10@} \cdot \int {@g10@}\mathrm{d}z \right)\mathrm{d}z \\ &= {@f10* intg10@}- \int {@df10*intg10@}\mathrm{d}z \end{align}\)

    We now need to find \(\displaystyle \int {@df10*intg10@} \mathrm{d}z \) using integration by part again. We get

    \(\begin{align} \int {@df10*intg10@} \mathrm{d}z = {@int(df10*intg10, z)@} \end{align}\)

    Altogether we have:

    \(\displaystyle{ \int {@exp10@} \mathrm{d}z= {@ta10@}}.\)

Vi bruker delvis integrasjon: \[ \int u{{\rm d}v\over {\rm d}x}{\rm d}x=uv- \int{{\rm d}u\over {\rm d}x}v\,{\rm d}x\]

alternativt: \[\int f(x)g(x)\,{\rm d}x=f(x)\,\int g(x){\rm d}x -\int {{\rm d}f\over {\rm d}x}\left\{\int g(x){\rm d}x\right\}{\rm d}x.\]

  1. Gitt integralet \({\displaystyle\int {@exp9@} \mathrm{d}x}.\)

    Vi velger \( f(x) = {@f9@}\) og \(g(x) = {@g9@}.\)

    Dermed:

    \(\begin{align} \int {@exp9@} \mathrm{d}x &={@f9@} \int {@g9@} \mathrm{d}x -\int \left({@df9@} \cdot \int {@g9@}\mathrm{d}x \right)\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@f9* intg9@}- \int {@df9*intg9@}\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@ta9@}. \end{align}\)

  2. Gitt integralet\(\displaystyle{ \int {@exp10@} \mathrm{d}z}.\)

    Velger \( f(z) = {@f10@}\) og \(g(z) = {@g10@}.\)

    Dermed:

    \(\begin{align} \int {@exp10@} \mathrm{d}z &={@f10@} \int {@g10@} \mathrm{d}z -\int \left({@df10@} \cdot \int {@g10@}\mathrm{d}z \right)\mathrm{d}z \\ &= {@f10* intg10@}- \int {@df10*intg10@}\mathrm{d}z \end{align}\)

    Nå må vi finne \(\displaystyle \int {@df10*intg10@} \mathrm{d}z \) med en ny runde delvis integrasjon. Da får vi

    \(\begin{align} \int {@df10*intg10@} \mathrm{d}z = {@int(df10*intg10, z)@} \end{align}\)

    Tilsammen får vi:

    \(\displaystyle{ \int {@exp10@} \mathrm{d}z= {@ta10@}}.\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
